questions.question: What is the central concept of Gnosticism?
questions.answer: Hidden knowledge (gnosis)

questions.question: How is dualism typically expressed in Gnostic thought?
questions.answer: Spiritual realm vs. Material world

questions.question: What is the 'divine spark' in Gnostic anthropology?
choices: A physical light within the human body
A fragment of divine essence within humans
questions.answer: A fragment of divine essence within humans

questions.question: Who is the Demiurge in Gnostic mythology?
choices: The creator of the spiritual realm
The creator of the material world
questions.answer: The creator of the material world

questions.question: How is the Demiurge often portrayed in Gnostic texts?
questions.answer: As ignorant, flawed, or malevolent

questions.question: Who is Sophia in Gnostic thought?
choices: A female divine being associated with wisdom
questions.answer: A female divine being associated with wisdom

questions.question: What is the primary goal of Gnostic practice?
choices: To awaken and nurture the divine spark
questions.answer: To awaken and nurture the divine spark

questions.question: How is gnosis different from ordinary knowledge?
choices: It is easily accessible to everyone
It is focused on material sciences
questions.answer: It is experiential and salvific

questions.question: In Gnostic texts, how is Jesus often portrayed?
choices: As a revealer of secret knowledge
questions.answer: As a revealer of secret knowledge

questions.question: How do Gnostic texts often reinterpret the Genesis creation story?
choices: They portray the serpent as a positive figure
They emphasize the role of angels
questions.answer: They portray the serpent as a positive figure

questions.question: What is the Gnostic view of the material world?
choices: It is the best of all possible worlds
It is a perfect creation of a benevolent God
It is the only reality that exists
questions.answer: It is corrupt and illusory

questions.question: In Gnostic thought, what is the path to salvation?
choices: Awakening to one's true nature and cultivating the divine spark
questions.answer: Awakening to one's true nature and cultivating the divine spark

questions.question: What is the significance of 'The Gospel of Thomas' in Gnostic literature?
choices: It is a biographical account of Jesus' life
It contains a collection of sayings attributed to Jesus
It describes the creation of the world
It is a letter from Thomas to early Christian communities
questions.answer: It contains a collection of sayings attributed to Jesus

questions.question: How do Gnostic texts often use language?
questions.answer: With complex symbolism and allegory

questions.question: What is the Gnostic concept of the 'Pleroma'?
choices: The fullness of the divine realm
questions.answer: The fullness of the divine realm

questions.question: In Gnostic classification, what are 'Pneumatics'?
choices: Individuals with a strong spiritual nature
questions.answer: Individuals with a strong spiritual nature

questions.question: What are 'Archons' in Gnostic thought?
choices: Powerful spiritual beings associated with the Demiurge
questions.answer: Powerful spiritual beings associated with the Demiurge

questions.question: How does the Gnostic view of Jesus differ from mainstream Christianity?
choices: Gnostics do not believe Jesus existed
Gnostics see Jesus as God incarnate
Gnostics view Jesus primarily as a teacher of secret knowledge
Gnostics believe Jesus was the Demiurge
questions.answer: Gnostics view Jesus primarily as a teacher of secret knowledge

questions.question: What is the significance of self-knowledge in Gnostic texts?
choices: It is seen as the key to spiritual liberation
It is considered irrelevant to spiritual growth
It is only important for spiritual leaders
questions.answer: It is seen as the key to spiritual liberation

questions.question: How do Gnostic texts often portray the God of the Old Testament?
choices: As a wise and just ruler
As the Demiurge, an imperfect or malevolent creator
As a mythological figure with no real existence
questions.answer: As the Demiurge, an imperfect or malevolent creator

questions.question: What is the Gnostic attitude towards the physical body?
choices: It is a temple to be honored
It is a prison for the divine spark
It is the source of all wisdom
It is irrelevant to spiritual development
questions.answer: It is a prison for the divine spark

questions.question: In Gnostic texts, what is often the role of a spiritual teacher?
questions.answer: To impart secret knowledge (gnosis)

questions.question: How do Gnostic texts typically view the process of creation?
choices: As a perfect act of a supreme God
questions.answer: As an accident or mistake

questions.question: What is the significance of the term 'Aeons' in Gnostic cosmology?
choices: They are divine emanations or attributes of the highest God
questions.answer: They are divine emanations or attributes of the highest God

questions.question: How do Gnostic texts often describe the relationship between knowledge and salvation?
choices: Salvation is predetermined and unaffected by knowledge
questions.answer: Knowledge (gnosis) is essential for salvation

questions.question: What is the Gnostic view on the nature of evil?
choices: Evil is a necessary balance to good
Evil is often associated with ignorance and the material world
Evil is more powerful than good
questions.answer: Evil is often associated with ignorance and the material world

questions.question: In Gnostic thought, what is the ultimate goal of human existence?
choices: To procreate and continue the species
To escape the material world and return to the divine realm
questions.answer: To escape the material world and return to the divine realm

questions.question: How do Gnostic texts often portray the concept of time?
choices: As an illusion of the material world
questions.answer: As an illusion of the material world

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'bridal chamber' in some Gnostic texts?
choices: A literal place for marriage ceremonies
A metaphor for union with the divine
questions.answer: A metaphor for union with the divine

questions.question: How do Gnostic texts typically view the role of faith?
choices: As the most important aspect of spirituality
As secondary to direct, experiential knowledge (gnosis)
questions.answer: As secondary to direct, experiential knowledge (gnosis)
